title: SoC RTVF 475-0-20 Grad Prod Wkshop
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Registration is reserved for Documentary Media MFA Students.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Students will be introduced to the technical and theoretical components necessary for media construction: narrative, sound, image, and editing. Projects will include audio and video exercises and will culminate in the production of group short films.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will have a working knowledge of the core components, both technical and theoretical, of creating media.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Projects will be evaluated on technical achievement (videography, sound, editing, lighting, and production design) as well as their ability to convey narrative. There will also be written and practical exams.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
CAGE/EQUIPMENT DEPOSIT: $50 cash (refundable)

USB 3.0 portable external hard drive (at least 500 GB recommended)

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
Students in this course will learn and use the Panasonic HPX camcorder, a Zoom audio recorder and microphones, a basic lighting kit, and editing.

Students must pay a $50 refundable equipment deposit to the equipment cage in Louis Hall by week 2 of the quarter. This is a pre-requisite for checking out the required equipment for class, as well as using the editing lab.
